Title: fauna_bear_black
Content:
The American Black Bear is strictly a native of North America, where it roams the many kinds of forests. While they are called a black bear, their fur can also be a cinnamon, yellow brown or even a gray-blue.

Black Bears are omnivores, which means they will eat anything from nuts and plants, to fish to even ants and bees. They eat over the course of summer and fall and then hibernate through the winter.
